com.android.internal.policy.impl.keyguard

Class FaceUnlock

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.android.internal.policy.impl.keyguard.FaceUnlock
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.os.Handler.Callback

    public class FaceUnlock
extends java.lang.Object
implements android.os.Handler.Callback

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FaceUnlock(android.content.Context context)
      Stores some of the structures that Face Unlock will need to access and creates the handler will be used to execute messages on the UI thread.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cleanUp()
      Frees up resources used by Face Unlock and stops it if it is still running.
      int getQuality()
      Returns the Device Policy Manager quality for Face Unlock, which is BIOMETRIC_WEAK.
      boolean handleMessage(android.os.Message msg)
      Handles messages such that everything happens on the UI thread in a deterministic order.

      Stores and displays the view that Face Unlock is allowed to draw within.

      Indicates whether Face Unlock is currently running.

      boolean stop()
      Stops Face Unlock and unbinds from the service.
      void stopAndShowBackup()

    • Constructor Detail

      • FaceUnlock

        public FaceUnlock(android.content.Context context)
        Stores some of the structures that Face Unlock will need to access and creates the handler will be used to execute messages on the UI thread.

    • Method Detail

      • setKeyguardCallback

        public void setKeyguardCallback(KeyguardSecurityCallback keyguardScreenCallback)

      • initializeView

        public void initializeView(android.view.View biometricUnlockView)
        Stores and displays the view that Face Unlock is allowed to draw within. TODO: since the layout object will eventually be shared by multiple biometric unlock methods, we will have to add our other views (background, cancel button) here.
        Parameters:
        biometricUnlockView - View provided for the biometric unlock UI.

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Indicates whether Face Unlock is currently running.
        Returns:
        whether the biometric unlock is currently running.

      • stopAndShowBackup

        public void stopAndShowBackup()
        Dismisses face unlock and goes to the backup lock

      • start

        public boolean start()
        Binds to the Face Unlock service. Face Unlock will be started when the bind completes. The Face Unlock view is displayed to hide the backup lock while the service is starting up. Called on the UI thread.
        Returns:
        false if it can't be started or the backup should be used.

      • stop

        public boolean stop()
        Stops Face Unlock and unbinds from the service. Called on the UI thread.
        Returns:
        whether the biometric unlock was running when called.

      • cleanUp

        public void cleanUp()
        Frees up resources used by Face Unlock and stops it if it is still running.

      • getQuality

        public int getQuality()
        Returns the Device Policy Manager quality for Face Unlock, which is BIOMETRIC_WEAK.
        Returns:
        biometric unlock sensor quality, as defined by Device Policy Manager.

      • handleMessage

        public boolean handleMessage(android.os.Message msg)
        Handles messages such that everything happens on the UI thread in a deterministic order. Calls from the Face Unlock service come from binder threads. Calls from lockscreen typically come from the UI thread. This makes sure there are no race conditions between those calls.
        Specified by:
        handleMessage in interface android.os.Handler.Callback
